question:
(a)(i) Name the farm animal which produces specimen A (Honey).

(iii) State four uses of specimen A.

(b)(i) Outline the steps involved in the preparation of bone meal from specimen B (Bone) for livestock feed.

(ii) State two precautions which should be taken during the preparation of bone meal.

(iii) Mention two minerals which could be obtained from specimen B.
answer:
(a)(i) Farm Animal that Produces Apecimen A (Honey);-Honey bee.

(ii) Other products Derived from Honey Bee;-Bee wax. -Propolis/resin. -Royal jelly. -Bee bread. -Bee pollen. -Mead/honey wine. 

(iii) Use of Honey; -As food/sweetners. -Confectionaris. -Cosmetics. -Preservative. -Medicinal purpose. -Pharmaceutical. -As baits for bees. -As feed/consumption.

(b)(i) Steps Involved in the Preparation of Bone Meal for Livestock Feed; -Collect/obtain bones. -Clean/wash bones.-Dry bones. -Burn bones/heating of bone. -Crush/grind to specification. -Package into suitable container 

OR

-Collect/obtain bones. -Clean /wash bones. -Heat bones with steam. -Crush/grind bones to specification. -Dry crushed bones. -Package into suitable container.

(ii) Precautions Observed During the Preparation of Bone Meal; -Ensure the use of bones from healthy animals. -Ensure proper drying. Ensure proper burning/steaming. -Ensure proper crushing to specification/well milled. -Avoid conatmination of bones. -Ensure usage of safety gears.

(iii) Mineral Obtained from Specimen B (Bone); -Calciim  -Phosphorous

question:
(a) State three factors which could affect the hatchability of specimen J (Egg).

(b)(i) Mention four operations that should be carried out on the first day of production of specimen K (Chick)

(ii) Name three diseases for which specimen K requires vaccination before it is six weeks old.

(c)(i) Name the type of housing unit used for rearing specimen K on arrival at the farm .

(ii) Mention four rquipment which are required in the housing unit named in 4(c)(i).
answer:
(a) Factors Affecting Hatchability of Egg (Specimen J); -Physical defect. -Heredity/breed/strain. -Egg deformity/double yolk. -Fertility of egg/egg quality. -Handling/selection of eggs. -Cleanliness of egg/contaminated egg. - Incubation condition (temperatur, humidity, sanitation). -Egg size/weight. -Age of breeders. -Storage duration/condition. -Turning of eggs.

(b)(i) Operations Carried out During the First Day of Production of Specimen K (Chick); -Vaccination. -Sexing. -Boxing. -Drying of chicks. -Sorting/seperate. -Brooding/temperature control. -Feed supply. -Water supply. -Medication/glucose. -Beak trimming 

(ii) Diseases which Require Vaccination of Chicks Before Six Weeks of Age; -Newcastle disease. -Infectious bronchitis. -Marek's/<arek disease. -Coccidiosis. - Gumboro/infectious bursal disease. -Fowl pox.

(c)(i) Type of Housing Unit for Rearing Chicks; -Brooder house/unit

(ii) Equipment Required in a Brooder House; -Drinkers. -Feeders. -Hover. -Weighing scale. -Thermometer. -Rake/fork/shovel/spade. -Head pan/wheel barrow/bucket/basket. -Chick guard. -Light bulb/lamp. -Heat source. -Sprayer. -Debeaker. -Syringe/dropper.
